title: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The problem is that the org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class in win32 uses Class.forName() to create a new instance of the Callback class.
SR: To fix this issue, the usage of Class.forName() should be removed from the BidiUtil class. Instead, the Callback class should be instantiated directly without using reflection. This will prevent a NoClassDefFoundError from being thrown in the CLDC version of SWT.
